item.title: Anerley Road SE19 2AN outside number 100 is a, 17th August
item.description:
Anerley Road SE19 2AN outside number 100 is a pedestrian crossing set of traffic lights – poles of traffic lights have a number of polycarbonate flyposters boards plastic zip tied to them.

item.title: Crossing, 17th August
item.description:
The crossing at the Broadway j/w Albion Rd is very dangerous. It is unclear to drivers that this is a crossing. It needs to be painted black and white like a normal crossing so the car drivers know to stop. I was almost run over trying to cross this ridiculous crossing today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Broadway, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping once again. Same people., 17th August
item.description:
You cleaned it again today. Straight away around 9:10pm-9:35pm there has been more fly tipping from the same people as yesterday. I would like you to investigate as it’s the same people. Put cameras or have a housing person who walks around/is available 24/7 with a phone number to stop these people. This is ridiculous and the noise is too loud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villa Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: To whom it concerns I would like to bring this anti-social behavior and criminal activity to your attention. Hackney Council mayor. Metropolitan police commissioner. Residence feel unsafe with this illegal activity and criminals operating in the area. Dangerous criminals storing class A drugs, Rambo style knife. Can the authority reassure residence they're doing their best to keep them safe And put in more CCTV in the area to keep members of public safe. DRUGS WARRANT EXECUTED IN HACKNEY WICK This morning, officers from the Hackney Wick Safer Neighbourhoods Team (SNT) executed a drugs warrant at an address in Hackney Wick, following community reports of suspected drug dealing in the area. A large quantity of Class A drugs was recovered, along with Rambo-style knives and other dangerous weapons. One male has been arrested and is currently in police custody. This action is part of our continued efforts to keep Hackney Wick safe. We are committed to tackling crime and anti-social behaviour in the ward. We need your help – if you see or suspect any criminal activity in your area, please report it to police via 101 or anonymously to Crimestoppers at 0800 555 111. In an emergency, always call 999. Together, we can make Hackney Wick safer for everyone, 17th August
item.description:
To whom it concerns I would like to bring this anti-social behavior and criminal activity to your attention. Hackney Council mayor. Metropolitan police commissioner. Residence feel unsafe with this illegal activity and criminals operating in the area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reading Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
